selectedVerses.text: So Israel yoked himself to Baal of Peor. And the anger of the LORD was kindled against Israel.
And Moses said to the judges of Israel, "Each of you kill those of his men who have yoked themselves to Baal of Peor."
The men did so, and took two milk cows and yoked them to the cart and shut up their calves at home.
Then they yoked themselves to the Baal of Peor, and ate sacrifices offered to the dead;
Do not be unequally yoked with unbelievers. For what partnership has righteousness with lawlessness? Or what fellowship has light with darkness?
